result.execSummary:
The defendant Ching Leng Her was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for unpaid court obligiations

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF151 Pierce County

miscConds.notes:

Comply with conditions imposed by Agent.

records.addlTxt: 11:56 Defendant Ching Leng Her in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Tou Yang Hmong interpreter is sw. One minor correction by defense. Sister- Nea Her listed is actually a brother. No correction to the sentencing document. No corrections to the information by Atty Thorie Victim rights have been complied with. Victim would like to read a statement into the record. DW reads a statement to the defendant.  No other witnesses. Thorie gives his recomendation follow PSI recomendation for sentence including the ES conditions. The amount of restitution being requested is $461.96 and requests it remain open. No application Crime Victim Compenstation Fund. Judge encourages the attorneys to submit the application for CVCF.  Sentence credit of 2 days.    Atty Nelson requests 5 yrs probation., conditional 3-6 months jail sentence with huber for treatment and work. Concurrent supervision on that case as well.  Defendant addresses the court. The court orders: S/ W 5 yrs probation  Conditions:   6 months Pierce County Jail.  Huber is allowed for employment education and treatment. Sex offender registry for 15 years.   No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs. No entrance into bars or taverns without advanced prermission  of probation. Maintain full time employment or education      Restitution $461.91 Pay back any amounts or restitution paid by Crime Victim Compensation  Fund . The Court reserves the right to order to  make payments of any civil liability of the case. Comply with any treatment recomendations of Probation  comply with sex offender probation rules No contact with Debra Wilson, her immediate family, their residence or their place of employment.  Provide DNA Sample  CC and DNA SC     On 15CM119 Court orders S/W  1 Yr probation concurrent with probation in 15CF151  Cond: Court costs  DNA Surcharge and sample . On 15CF151: May serve sentence in Dunn Co Jail if defendant makes the arrangements  No electronic monitoring allowed.   Jail sentence stayed until September 6, 2016 at  7:00 PM  No good time  Credit for 2 days served.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant
Sentencing by Erin Olson of the Eau Claire Public Defender's Office along with three letter attachments

11:23  Defendant Ching Leng Her in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Swits Interpreter Tou Yang appears by telephone for defendants Mother.   NAME OF PARTY NEEDING INTERPRETER:  Defendant's Mother
NAME OF INTERPRETER: Tou Yang
AGENCY:Swits
LANGUAGE:Hmong
ON-SITE OR TELEPHONE:
START TIME:11:20
STOP TIME:11:55
Thorie addresses the court and states that he will be asking for a PSI and that we will also be taking a plea on 15CM119 today and he will be asking for probation on the 15CM119 case conc to the sentence in 15CF151.   Amended information is filed with the court with a charge of sexual intercourse with a person without the consent of the person.  Judge amends the document to read sexual contact instead of intercourse. 15CM119 Misd Criminal Trespass defendant pleads guilty.  15CF151 to the amended charge of 3rd degree sexual assualt defendant pleads guilty.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights   Facts are correct Court finds that a factual foundation supports these nego and accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty of 3rd degree sexual assualt and misdemeanor trespassing.  The court orders a PSI. The defense will also have an alternative PSI done will try to have completed in 60 days.  Court orders the defense to cooperate with the DA in determining resttitution. Bond conditions are to continue  Set for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.

12efendant Ching Leng Her in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Duvall appeared via phone for this hearing. 15CF151 and 15CM119 heard at this time. Thorie: Def is in the middle of an evaluation. Hoping to set for plea/sentencing. Atty Liesl responds; next appt is April and a report will be generated. Needs time to review the report. Thorie: set for a status. Nelson agrees. Court sets for a status.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

11:25 a.m.  Includes 15CM119.  Defendant Ching Leng Her in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nelson - needs some time for evaluation - four to six weeks out, Thorie in agreement, end of March or first part of April.  Court - victim  has the right for speedy trial. Set for phone status conference end of March.  March 24, 2016 at 12:45 p.m.  Judge Duvall will appear by phone.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 12:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: 3:57 Defendant Ching Leng Her in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court. 15CM119 heard at this time.   Defendant has copy of complaints. Court reads charges and maximum penalties.  Courts reads charging portion of the complaint on 15CF151: Def requested reading.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint on 15CM119.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. 15CF151: Thorie: $2000 cash bond; no contact with victims and residence. 15CM119: Thorie: $1000 cash bond with no contact.  Nelson: objection to cash bond and requests a signature bond on each file. Agrees to no contact with victims or residence. Def pleas not guilty to 15CM119. Def was in the National Guard for 2 years.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 08-26-2015 09:30 am
